experiences.title: News Intern
experiences.description: Investigated large databases to cover the intersection of race, labor and climate. Geoprocessed raster data across the U.S.to report on systemic bias in FEMA flood risk assessments. Wrote and produced stories with interactive charts and maps.

stories.hed: Low-income, Black, Hispanic Communities Rebounded Weeks Faster in Movement
stories.description: Wrote code that processed hundreds of gigabytes of longitudinal location data in under a minute, revealing stark movement and labor disparities in New York’s reopening. The story garnered more than 31,000 terminal and web views.

experiences.title: Graphics Intern
experiences.description: Covered U.S. immigration and protests in Puerto Rico with data and visualization. Wrote data-driven stories about asylum seekers and the Hong Kong protests. Produced breaking visual coverage of debates, shootings, and the impeachment.

stories.hed: A Bird’s-Eye View of How Protesters Have Flooded Hong Kong Streets
stories.description: Multimedia maps depict the scale of last summer’s protests. The story won a Malofiej Gold and a Malofiej Human Rights Best Graphic Award, as well as the SOPA Award for Excellence in Information Graphics.

experiences.title: Graphics Deputy Editor
experiences.description: Conceptualize and develop enterprise data projects. Direct and edit all data stories and visualizations, managing ten reporters and overseeing five assignments a week.

stories.description: Scraped jobs platform for over a year to depict the steep decline in job availability and visa sponsorship.

stories.hed: West Harlem residents fall under the most at risk groups for contracting COVID. High poverty rates make recovery an uphill battle.
stories.description: Data and visuals showing the pandemic’s risk disparity in West Harlem.

tools.value: Python, R, SQL, web scraping, shell scripting, Make, AWS

more_experiences.title: Web Editor
more_experiences.description: Spearheaded design (4 months) and development (6 months) of React website, Rails/GraphQL server, and Go uploader, managing 10 people over 3 teams. Engineered a Go CLI to automatically format and upload nearly 40 articles biweekly, reaching 3,000 monthly readers.
